intro: Rhexia paniculata, commonly known as the showy rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of oval, dark green leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Rhexia paniculata thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks.
